main event: On July 20, 1958, a civilian observed a yellow or orange object flashing and circling the Buffalo, New York area for 2 minutes. The shape of the object was described as two large and three small with sparks coming out of the rear end.
interesting points: The observation was made using Ground-Radar technology.
The sighting lasted for 2 minutes, providing a relatively detailed observation period.
The UFO was described as having yellow or orange lights and circling Buffalo, New York.
The report indicates that there were no photographs of the UFO.
The conclusion drawn from the report was that there was insufficient data, with a suggestion that it could be astro-physical or technical in nature.
result: Insufficient data. Possibly astro-physical or technical.
sighted object: Yellow or orange object circling Buffalo, New York
